meanings.definition: The solid surface of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The puppy dug a hole in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake shook the ground violently.
meanings.sent3: The ground seemed to play hide and seek with the mole.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit me like a ton of bricks, knocking me to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The ground felt cool and damp beneath my bare feet.

meanings.definition: The basis or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: Trust is the ground of any strong relationship.
meanings.sent2: The ground of his argument was solid and well-reasoned.
meanings.sent3: The ground of the cake was made of chocolate, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Love is the ground on which happiness grows.
meanings.sent5: The ground of the building was made of sturdy concrete.

meanings.sent1: She will ground you on how to bake a cake.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will ground the students on the importance of honesty.
meanings.sent3: He tried to ground his friend on the art of fishing, but ended up tangled in the line.
meanings.sent4: The coach grounded the team on the fundamentals of the game.
meanings.sent5: I will ground you on the rules of the competition before it starts.
